agreementRates - Variable in class org.platanios.learn.combination.error.EstimationData
The agreement rates structure used for the error rates estimation (this structure contains the sample agreement rates that are used for defining the equality constraints of the optimization problem involved in the error rates estimation).
agreementRates - Variable in class org.platanios.learn.combination.error.OptimizationProblem
The agreement rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the sample agreement rates that are used for defining the equality constraints of the problem).
AgreementRatesPowerSetVector - Class in org.platanios.learn.combination.error
A structure that holds the agreement rates of all possible subsets of a set of functions of cardinality greater than or equal to 2.
AgreementRatesPowerSetVector(int, int, boolean[][]) - Constructor for class org.platanios.learn.combination.error.AgreementRatesPowerSetVector
Constructs a power set indexed vector, holding the agreement rates, stored as a one-dimensional array and initializes the values of those agreement rates to the sample agreement rates computed from the observed outputs of the functions for a set of data samples, where only subsets of functions of even cardinality are considered.
AgreementRatesPowerSetVector(int, int, boolean[][], boolean) - Constructor for class org.platanios.learn.combination.error.AgreementRatesPowerSetVector
Constructs a power set indexed vector, holding the agreement rates, stored as a one-dimensional array and initializes the values of those agreement rates to the sample agreement rates computed from the observed outputs of the functions for a set of data samples, where an option is given on whether or not to only consider sets of even cardinality within the power set.

ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch - Class in org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch
Implements an interpolation based line search algorithm that returns a step size value that satisfies the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition).
